posts.post_content:
Many people seem unhappy that she can't do more for a discard deck, but I think Liliana's true home is a reanimation deck, where she can live up to her title of "Grave Witch". All three of her abilities help this decktype to some degree.  
  
1st Ability: If you use it on yourself, it helps pitch fatties to the graveyard for reanimation. After you pitch your fatties, you can use her ability on your opponent to catch up on card advantage.  
  
2nd Ability: Reanimation decks love tutors, as they need a very balanced mix of fatties, ways to get them in the graveyard, and reanimation spells.   
  
3rd Ability: As rarely as this goes off, it pretty much guarantees you the win if you pull it off in a dedicated reanimator deck. This isn't the main reason to use her, as some believe, but it sure is nice if it resolves.  
  
Of course, Liliana is a little on the expensive side for a reanimator deck, but it's perfectly vIable in casual, especially when you have [Dark Ritual/autoca](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual/autoca)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

1st Ability: If you use it on yourself, it helps pitch fatties to the graveyard for reanimation. After you pitch your fatties, you can use her ability on your opponent to catch up on card advantage.

2nd Ability: Reanimation decks love tutors, as they need a very balanced mix of fatties, ways to get them in the graveyard, and reanimation spells.

3rd Ability: As rarely as this goes off, it pretty much guarantees you the win if you pull it off in a dedicated reanimator deck. This isn't the main reason to use her, as some believe, but it sure is nice if it resolves.

Of course, Liliana is a little on the expensive side for a reanimator deck, but it's perfectly vIable in casual, especially when you have Dark Ritual/autoca... (see all)

posts.post_content: So glad she is getting love from M11. She is a very fun to play, but typically overlooked. She combines a continuous TARGETED discard effect, a top-of-library tutor (which combines wonderfully with jace beleren) and mass rise from the grave. Very black, very flavorful.

posts.post_content:
I think Vess will be back (or even Vess 2.0) in Innistrad's Block. I know it's grasping as straws but they've found a Vess deck (along with others) hidden in DotP 2012's files. Meaning it will probably be unlocked in an expansion (i.e. after or just before the next set). There are also cards we have never seen before in these decks, 2 in Vess' deck. The art and flavor both follow the 'dark' theme of the new set.  
  
Maybe it's just wishful thinking but it all seems to point in that direction. That's just my speculation though.

posts.post_content: Liliana is an All star in Commander. Her first ability helps to make enemies/allies, her Second ability lets you fetch that piece that you need(Which is super important in Commander) and her last ability(Although I never have used it. I always just plus so I can ruin peoples hands then use the second so I can fetch what I need) pulls everything from the grave that I spent the whole game killing.
